This page features projects from STAT 541: Advanced Statistical Computing with R, a 4-unit graduate course covering high-level programming techniques in R for statistical analysis and software development. Topics included version control, dynamic visualizations, functional programming, recursion, and efficient handling of large datasets. Each lab highlights a different skill or tool explored throughout the course.
